title: Katrin Leschke
summary: Katrin Leschke (born 1968)[1] is a German mathematician specialising in differential geometry and known for her work on quaternionic analysis and Willmore surfaces. She works in England as a reader in mathematics at the University of Leicester,[2] where she also heads the "Maths Meets Arts Tiger Team", an interdisciplinary group for the popularisation of mathematics,[3] and led the "m:iv" project of international collaboration on minimal surfaces.[4]
